title: Scenario-Based White Blood Cell Structure and Function E-Learning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic cell biology and immunology concepts
context.additional_context: A course enhancing clinical application skills through scenario-based learning in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify and explain the structural characteristics of five major types of white blood cells.
Learners can analyze the clinical functions of leukocytes (e.g., infection response, immune regulation) based on real-world cases.
Learners achieve at least 80% proficiency in interpreting leukocyte counts through scenario-based formative assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
